title: Ethereum in 2023: Here’s What to Look Forward To - CoinDesk
summary: Ethereum devs to gather in 2023 for Devcon, a major conference for Ethereum developers, with location TBD. Event a highlight for Ethereum enthusiasts to share ideas and innovations.

title: Bitcoin analyst identifies new key levels as Ethereum price nears 3-week high - Cointelegraph
summary: Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) prices are consolidating, with BTC trading in a tight range and ETH showing bullish signs. Analyst Filbfilb identifies key levels for BTC, including $15,500 and $18,000, and notes that a positive CPI print could give BTC price action the catalyst it needs. ETH is trading within a consolidation pattern, with support levels at $1,000-1,100. QCP Capital expects the crypto market bottom to come in October or November, but remains open-minded to a sooner bottom.

title: Will crypto recover in 2023? Analysts offer cautious bull case - Business Insider
summary: Crypto had a tough year in 2022, with the value of bitcoin dropping 64% and the implosion of FTX. However, some analysts remain optimistic about the space's potential. Bernstein analysts Gautam Chhugani and Manas Agarwal argue that crypto has a "survival instinct" and will bounce back due to its decentralized nature, strong foundation in Ethereum, and potential benefits from regulation. They note that crypto has been through similar downturns in the past and has always rallied, and that DeFi projects are largely insulated from FTX's impact. Additionally, they believe that regulation will bring more institutional investors to the space and create a more sustainable ecosystem. Despite the challenges, the analysts see crypto as having strong potential to grow and become a part of the infrastructure of the next decade of internet development.

title: What is Wrapped Ethereum (WETH)? - OKX
summary: Wrapped Ethereum (WETH) is a version of Ether (ETH) that is wrapped in an ERC-20 token standard, allowing it to be used on various platforms and decentralized applications (DApps) that support the standard. WETH is pegged to the value of ETH at a 1:1 ratio, and can be easily converted between the two tokens. The main advantage of WETH is its increased interoperability and compatibility with different platforms, making it a more versatile and useful token than ETH alone. Additionally, WETH can be used for various DeFi applications such as yield farming, lending, and providing liquidity to liquidity pools.

title: Only 20% of All Staked Ethereum (stETH) is in Profit, Lido Finance Leads Staking - DailyCoin
summary: Only 20% of staked Ethereum (stETH) is in profit, according to Dune Analytics data. Lido Finance leads staking with 25% of total staked ETH. Most profits were made at $600 price level in December 2020. ETH currently trades at $1,250, up from an all-time high of $4,891.

title: Ethereum Name Service Recorded Over 2.8M Domain Registrations in 2022 - CoinDesk
summary: Ethereum Name Service (ENS) recorded over 2.8M domain registrations in 2022, with September seeing the most registrations at 430K unique domains, followed by May with the most new users at 64K. December saw the lowest registrations at 52K domains.

title: Grayscale ETH trust nears record 60% discount as nerves continue over DCG - Cointelegraph
summary: Grayscale Ethereum Trust (ETHE) is trading at a record 60% discount, with shares falling 93% from its June 2019 high. The discount is due to fears of fallout from Digital Currency Group's (DCG) debt of $1.675 billion to troubled crypto lender Genesis, which could impact Grayscale assets. Most of Grayscale's trust funds are trading at a discount, with the Ethereum Classic Trust hit hardest at 77%, followed by Litecoin Trust at 65% and Bitcoin Cash Trust at 57%. Only two Grayscale Trusts are currently trading at a premium, with the Filecoin Trust at 108% and the Chainlink Trust at 24%. Grayscale's parent company DCG is under fire after Cameron Winklevoss accused DCG CEO Barry Silbert of owing Gemini $900 million in funds lent to it as part of Gemini's Earn product. Arcane Research suggests that DCG may initiate a Reg M distribution, which could lead to a

title: Ethereum Name Service Recorded Over 2.8M Domain Registrations in 2022 - Yahoo Movies UK
summary: Ethereum Name Service (ENS) recorded over 2.8 million domain registrations in 2022, with a lifetime high of 430,000 registrations in September and a low of 52,000 in December. Many buyers are treating ENS domains as investments, purchasing popular and common names and selling them for a profit. The record sale of "000.eth" for 300 ether (ETH) fueled interest in three-digit ENS names as traders tried to capitalize on the hype.

title: Ethereum Builder ConsenSys and AMD SPAC Plows on Despite 95% of Shares Being Redeemed - CoinDesk
summary: ConsenSys, a leading Ethereum builder, and AMD SPAC, a special-purpose acquisition company, are continuing their partnership despite 95% of shares being redeemed. The combination was expected to bring $345 million to the balance sheet of the combined business and value it at $1.25 billion. However, following the redemption vote filed over Christmas, the SPAC now has only $16.6 million remaining in its coffers.

summary:

title: Core Scientific To Sunset 37,000 Celsius Bitcoin Mining Machines - Ethereum World News
summary: Core Scientific will shut down 37,000 Bitcoin mining machines owned by Celsius, a defunct crypto lender, following an agreement between the two companies. The deal was reached during a bankruptcy hearing and comes after both companies filed for bankruptcy in 2022 due to harsh crypto market conditions. Core Scientific had been losing around $53,000 daily due to hosting fees, and the deal includes a payment of $5.4 million in hosting fees claimed by Core Scientific last year. Other crypto companies, such as Riot Blockchain and Argo Blockchain, have also filed for bankruptcy or are diversifying their businesses to mitigate the impact of rising power costs in the U.S. on their mining operations.

title: Ethereum transactions 338% higher 2022; co-founder Vitalik Buterin shares what he’s bullish on this year - Times Now
summary: Ethereum transactions surged 338% in 2022 compared to Bitcoin, with 408.5 million transactions on the Ethereum network vs 93.1 million on the Bitcoin network. Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin is bullish on the rollout of EIP 4884, which aims to achieve "basic rollup scaling" and improve the network's scalability. He also believes that payments and DeFi will play a major role in the future of crypto.

title: 5 Trends From 2022 to Watch Out For in 2023 - bitcoinke.io
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Five trends to watch in 2023:

1. Ethereum staking grew significantly in 2022, with almost 7 million $ETH deposited to the Beacon Chain and 15.84 million $ETH staked, 13.14% of the entire supply.
2. L2 scaling solutions, such as Optimism and Arbitrum, emerged and grew significantly in 2022, with daily transactions rising from 200k to 1 million.
3. Self-custody saw an increase in 2022, with assets flowing out of centralized platforms (CEX) and into self-custody wallets.
4. Wash trading remains a significant issue in the NFT market, accounting for 58% of NFT trading volume in 2022.
5. Investors withdrew their stablecoins from smart contracts in 2022, with the share of DAI, USDC & USDT held by smart contracts

title: Hackers steal $3.5M worth of digital assets from GMX whale - Cointelegraph
summary: Hackers stole $3.5M worth of digital assets from a large GMX whale, with 82,519 GMX tokens transferred to an Ethereum wallet. The hack was discovered on January 3, with the attackers using Hop Protocol and Across Protocol to cross-chain the assets. The token's value dropped temporarily before recovering. This incident highlights the risks of self-custody and the recent spate of DeFi hacks, with Bitcoin core developer Luke Dashjr also losing BTC to hackers on January 1.

title: Ethereum Classic Price Prediction: ETC Breaks The Consolidation, Will It Continue The Upside? - The Coin Republic
summary: Ethereum Classic (ETC) price is surging after Coinbase announced it will not support the native tokens of Bitcoin Cash (BCH) and Ethereum Classic. Technical indicators are favoring the upside move, with a gain of over 8% in the intraday session. The weekly chart shows a consolidated trend, but the daily chart suggests a breakout and potential rally to $25. Support levels are at $12. The article concludes that ETC may see a new high in the near future, but investing in crypto assets comes with financial risks.
